title: Confused need help.
body: So a few days ago my LoL Client works just fine. But the next few days I experience a sudden FPS drop>freeze>black screen>repeat in-game and it's kind of irritating and I wonder why it happens to me only and not my friends. I tried to lower the quality and that didn't improve my FPS, I also tried to "Repair" corrupted files if there were any and it still didn't work for me. Is it because I have to update my graphics driver to the latest? It tells me that in my notification center exactly "Application League of Legends has been blocked from accessing Graphics hardware." and I don't know if there is a latest graphics driver. Someone help me please.

replies.body:
FPS problems can be caused by a lot of different factors, but I think your description, specifically the last part, really points out where the issue may lie. I recommend working through our [FPS troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) and specifically focusing on the drivers and windows power settings steps. 

If you continue to see issues after working through that guide, please let me know.

I have tried most of the possible things to make it work for Windows 10 and when I went to go test it out again in a Custom Game I'm just getting the same results. On Windows 10 I remember there was a new update during the week and I don't know if that update affected my gameplay for League.

I've definitely seen some players report having issues specifically after running the recent Windows 10 Anniversary updates. If you' like, you can try uninstalling those updates or rolling back to before you installed them to see if anything changes. As for the video sample, you can toss it on any video hosting site and send me a link here if you'd like.

Going back to previous update before I installed it was actually a great idea and it worked out really well. I tested it out in a Custom Game and went through out the whole entire match and nothing happened it was running smoothly. Thank you for helping me out :)
I can show you a sample of what it looks like; I have a clip of it so you can see what I'm experiencing. I just need to know where/whom to send it to.
If none of the above have worked, I would recommend upgrading your PC graphics card (Last case scenario).

1. Turn your Router/Modem off for 20-30 seconds than reboot it back up and test if the ping is better in a custom game.

2. Try contacting your ISP about your internet service plan you're paying for. If you had lower ms normally and recently have been getting very high ms, it may be on there end. You will have to see what's going on with the download/upload speed plan.

3. Try contacting Riot through the support ticket and see if it's on there end.

The internet is not the problem. It's the sudden FPS drop I recieve while playing which causes me to freeze for a sec then black screen for less than .5 of a second, then the frames go back to normal which is really sketchy.
